channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How North Carolina erased medical debt for 2.5 million people
item.description: The state partnered with a nonprofit to wipe out the debts. It also has a plan in place to prevent medical debt for people in specific income brackets...

item.title: Blinken and British counterpart signal trans-Atlantic unity with visit to Ukraine
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and his British counterpart, David Lammy, are raising alarms about Iranian ballistic missiles in Russia that threate...

item.title: How ICE grew to be the highest-funded U.S. law enforcement agency
item.description: ICE's budget hovered around $10 billion for years. But President Trump and the Republican-controlled Congress are taking the agency's funding to unpre...

item.title: Trump administration claims offshore wind poses a threat. But it won't say how.
item.description: The Interior Department said pausing construction of offshore wind farms would allow the government agencies to work with project developers to mitiga...

item.title: What to expect from Trump's Davos speech. And, the DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials
item.description: President Trump is expected to address affordability at the World Economic Forum today. And, Minnesota officials react after the Justice Department su...

item.title: Actor used reputation as medicine man to prey on women, prosecutors say
item.description: Nathan Chasing Horse's defense attorney said prosecutors would present no evidence of the allegations, including no DNA evidence or eyewitnesses.

item.title: Trump to address Davos as allies push back against his bid for Greenland
item.description: President Trump will address the gathering of world leaders, CEOs and policymakers as America's allies balk at his efforts to acquire Greenland.

item.title: More than 10 countries have signed onto Trump's "Board of Peace," sources say
item.description: More than 10 countries have signed on to join President Trump's "Board of Peace" for Gaza, sources familiar with the discussions told CBS News.

item.title: Nigeria police confirm mass church abductions after previous denial
item.description: More than 160 people were reportedly taken from three churches in the northern Kaduna state.

item.title: Ryanair boss thanks Elon Musk for 'boost' in ticket sales after online row
item.description: Musk and Ryanair boss Michael O'Leary have called each other "idiots" in recent days, but the airline executive says it's helping lift sales

item.title: Japan restarts world's largest nuclear plant
item.description: Japan restars a reactor at the world's largest nuclear plant nearly 15 years after the Fukushima disaster.

item.title: Ford recalls some 119,000 vehicles due to engine block heater fire risk, NHTSA says
item.description: Ford is recalling roughly 119,000 vehicles because their engine block heaters have a defect that increases the risk of fire, the National Highway Traf...

item.title: Detained veteran Ugandan opposition figure critically ill in hospital, his party says
item.description: Kizza Besigye’s party says his condition is critical, but authorities say he was taken to hospital for a routine check-up.

item.title: Lawmakers intensify efforts to remove Trump's name from Kennedy Center
item.description: At least one federal lawsuit and two bills in Congress aim to strip President Trump's name from the exterior sign at the Kennedy Center.

item.title: Legal battles over immigration enforcement operation in Minnesota intensify
item.description: Confrontations with federal officers over their massive immigration enforcement operation in Minnesota are showing no signs of stopping.

item.title: Life sentence for man who killed Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe
item.description: Abe's assassination stunned the country where there is virtually no gun crime.

item.title: Doctors in Minnesota decry fear and chaos amid Trump administration’s immigration crackdown
Forecasters warn of a ‘potentially catastrophic’ storm from Texas to the Carolinas
